fuzzing_params.Constraints: 1 <= coins.length <= 10^5, 1 <= k <= 10^9, coins[i] == [li, ri, ci], 1 <= li <= ri <= 10^9, 1 <= ci <= 1000. The given segments are non-overlapping.

problem_info.title: 3413. Maximum Coins From K Consecutive Bags
test_examples: Example 1:  Input: coins = [[8,10,1],[1,3,2],[5,6,4]], k = 4  Output: 10  Explanation:  Selecting bags at positions [3, 4, 5, 6] gives the maximum number of coins: 2 + 0 + 4 + 4 = 10.
Example 2:  Input: coins = [[1,10,3]], k = 2  Output: 6  Explanation:  Selecting bags at positions [1, 2] gives the maximum number of coins: 3 + 3 = 6.
